page.title: 18 Yardley Hastings Society
page.content: The above society was formed at the begining of this decade to raise money for worthy causes Its first Country Fayre was held in the grounds of Castle Ashby House in 1983, and was so successfull, that it raised over 6000 pounds, some of this money was used to renovate the Village Hall whilst the rest went to local charities. The 1984 Fayre was equally successfull, and some of the money was used to buy special equipment for the Princess Marina Hospital for Children in Northampton, as well asthe disc drive and printer for the village school's computer. The 1985 fayre will again be held at Castle Ashby at the begining of July The "Society",and the Parish Council are jointly undertaking the re-planning and re-equipping of the "Rec" with new play equipment and facilities.
